channel.title: How exactly does
channel.description:
Well, here it is, another noob question:
How exactly does runescape piece together each chunk of the world map (e.g., Varrock, Fally, Edge, etc.), or is the map data stored completely in the cache and loaded chunk by chunk?
So, in a 2D game, should I split up the world into different map pieces, or should I just make it one big world map and tell my client to load it piece by piece. If I were to split it up into maps, what kind of logic should i use for determining when to load what map?
Thankz, io9`

item.title: How exactly does
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Ollie, which method currently (or in the 473 release), handles the calculation of paths? I’m working on a world walker, but it’s difficult, especialy if you have about an hour a day

Read full topic

item.title: How exactly does
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

RS renders regions 104x104 tiles.
stored in 1 file, an algorithm extracts the relevant data.

item.title: How exactly does

item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

item.title: How exactly does
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I think it’s in different pieces. When you move from one piece to another, you get that loading please wait message. I guess you just get the x and y coordinates, and make it so that when x and/or y > piece2xy then load piece 2. :o

Read full topic
